article_title: Local Church Cleans Up the Streets in Meridian
article_text:
A local church were celebrating its eighth anniversary by getting out into the community Saturday.

Members of Prince of Peace Christian Fellowship Church got out to clean up some of downtown. The group focused on areas around there church and expanded from there. Ward four Councilwoman Kim Houston was also out there helping to clean up her part of the city. Pastor Zachray Operton he says he wants to get out and provide positivity and make the community look beautiful.

"Cleaning up, picking up. Making our community and citizens aware that it is important and vital for them to feel good about their environment," Operton says.

As part of the church’s anniversary celebration, they had invited Pastor Lorenzo Carter from Shubuta Sunday afternoon.
